content.question: Which of the following factors contributed most directly to the end of slavery in the United States?

choices.label: The movement of settlers to the West created new economic opportunities.
The arrival of immigrants from Europe and Asia provided an expanded labor force.
The advocacy of slavery as central to the Southâ€™s economy fostered a unique regional culture.
The Union victory in the Civil War led to the ratification of the Thirteenth Amendment.

content.answer: The Union victory in the Civil War led to the ratification of the Thirteenth Amendment.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
